main event: Multiple observers in Baker, Oregon reported seeing a bright, unidentified object in the sky on December 4, 1964 between 1252Z and 1336Z.
interesting points: The object was described as round, basketball-sized, and fluorescent blue in color.
The object appeared to have crater-like shadows on its surface and left a trail behind it as it moved.
The object was observed by both civilian and military personnel, including a city police officer and radar operators.
The object was tracked on radar, with intermittent and weak returns, but its size, location, and nature could not be definitively determined.
Weather conditions at the time were clear with calm surface winds and decreasing temperatures with increasing altitude.
witnesses: civilian and military personnel, including city police and radar operators
